etymology.description: semantic: 亼 ‘open mouth’ + semantic: 卩 ‘kneeling person’.
etymology.interpretation: Combines an open mouth issuing commands with a kneeling person receiving them, expressing the act of giving an order. Comparable to 兄, where a mouth on top also signals speaking or commanding.

examples.chinese: 将军下令进攻(將軍下令進攻)。
examples.english: The general gave the order to attack.

examples.chinese: 法院令他赔偿(法院令他賠償)。
examples.english: The court ordered him to compensate.

examples.chinese: 她令大家安静(她令大家安靜)。
examples.english: She ordered everyone to be quiet.
